meanings.definition: A place or position of strength or advantage.
meanings.sent1: The team's strongpoints helped them win the game.
meanings.sent2: She carefully considered her strongpoints before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: His love for ice cream is definitely one of his strongpoints.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude is a strongpoint that shines through in everything she does.
meanings.sent5: The bright smile on her face was her strongest point of all.

meanings.definition: A particular skill or area of expertise.
meanings.sent1: His cooking skills are his strongpoints in the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: She has many strongpoints that make her a valuable team member.
meanings.sent3: His strongpoint in math is calculating tips quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her strongpoint in painting is her use of vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The way he plays the guitar is a strongpoint that captivates the audience.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers defended the strongpoints along the border.
meanings.sent2: The general strategically placed the strongpoints to protect the troops.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels turned the tree into their strongpoint against the birds.
meanings.sent4: The castle stood as a strongpoint against any enemy attacks.
meanings.sent5: The fort was a strongpoint that symbolized the strength of the kingdom.
